resources.title: Self-Adapting Language Models
resources.description: This arXiv paper introduces SEAL, a framework where an LLM generates "self-edits"—training examples, optimization directives, and augmentation or gradient steps—to finetune itself via supervised finetuning. It trains the edit generator with a reinforcement learning loop using downstream performance as reward, and evaluates knowledge incorporation and few-shot generalization. Includes methods, experiments, and open-source code for reproducibility.

resources.title: ElevenLabs Image & Video Tutorial
resources.description: A step-by-step tutorial showing how to generate and export short videos using ElevenLabs Image & Video, including adding at least one audio layer and exporting to Studio. It matters for contest entrants because it explains the required workflow, submission format, and verification steps needed to qualify for the Image & Video contest.

resources.title: Disrupting the first reported AI-orchestrated cyber espionage campaign
resources.description: Analysis of the first reported AI‑orchestrated cyber espionage campaign by Anthropic, describing how threat actors used large language models and automation to scale reconnaissance, social engineering, and exploit development. The report documents evidence, attack techniques, evaluation results showing cyber capabilities doubling in six months, and mitigation steps aimed at security researchers, incident responders, and policymakers. It summarizes detection, disruption, and implications for defensive AI governance.

resources.title: Understanding Neural Networks Through Sparse Circuits
resources.description: Blog post describing a new training method that produces small language models with sparser internal circuits, making their mechanisms easier for humans to inspect and interpret. This approach aims to improve understanding of complex model structures (like those behind ChatGPT) and to reduce gaps in how we analyze neural network behavior.

resources.title: XPeng unveils IRON humanoid robot demonstration
resources.description: Footage of XPeng's AI-powered humanoid robot "IRON", shown on Nov 5, demonstrating humanlike gait and appearance that prompted viewers to mistake it for a person. The clip highlights progress in robot locomotion and appearance and raises questions about public perception, authenticity, and ethical implications for humanoid robotics.

resources.title: Python Q&A and Discussion — Final Module
resources.description: Final module video presenting a Python Q&A and group discussion for cohort participants. Intended as a wrap-up and self-directed follow-up, it accompanies module work you can continue independently and outlines next steps (moving learners to a post-course role). The session consolidates learning and collects course feedback.

resources.title: Git Primer: Basic Version Control Workflow
resources.description: A short primer introducing core Git concepts and common workflows for new users. Explains how to manage commits, branches, and collaboration so you can track changes, sync with remotes, and reduce merge conflicts. Serves as a foundational overview to prepare you for Git-based project work.

resources.title: Primer on Git Basics and Workflow
resources.description: A concise primer covering Git fundamentals — repositories, commits, branching, and basic workflows — aimed at preparing learners for course Git tasks. It explains core version-control operations and collaboration practices so participants can manage code history, resolve merges, and follow project workflows for assignments and team work.

resources.title: Claude for Financial Services (Anthropic offering)
resources.description: An Anthropic offering that adapts the Claude generative AI model for financial-services organizations. It presents a version of Claude tailored to sector needs, with attention to regulatory, compliance and sensitive-data handling. It matters because financial institutions evaluating AI require models and deployments that address legal and privacy constraints.

resources.title: Aardvark: GPT-5 agent for security bug fixing
resources.description: Aardvark is an OpenAI private-beta agent that uses GPT-5 to locate and propose fixes for security vulnerabilities in code. It matters because automating detection and remediation can assist security teams, accelerate fixes, and potentially reduce the window of exposure for software vulnerabilities during development and deployment.

resources.title: ElevenLabs Voice Isolator How to Use
resources.description: Tutorial demonstrating how to use ElevenLabs Voice Isolator to remove background noise from voice recordings. The video shows a before-and-after workflow and explains the steps creators should follow for the Voice Isolator Contest, enabling participants to produce cleaner audio for short social-media entry videos.

resources.title: Google for Government: cloud and AI solutions
resources.description: Overview of Google for Government, a Google initiative offering integrated cloud and AI capabilities for government agencies, spanning infrastructure to end-user applications. It outlines secure cloud features and AI tools and highlights use-case discussions and deployment considerations presented at Google's DC conference, relevant to public-sector modernization.

resources.title: gpt-oss-safeguard: Open Safeguard Hackathon in SF
resources.description: An event (Dec. 8, San Francisco) hosted by OpenAI with ROOST and Hugging Face to explore how open-weight models can shape safer digital spaces. The hackathon focuses on open-weight reasoning and online safety research, bringing developers together to prototype and discuss open-model approaches to moderation and safety.

resources.title: Spotify MCP server for NLP playlist creation
resources.description: GitHub repository implementing a Spotify MCP server for experimenting with vibe coding and AI. It provides features to create playlists and add tracks using natural-language commands, enabling developers to test NLP-driven music selection and automate playlist workflows. Suitable for contributors who want to extend or use the project.

resources.title: AI, Invisible Decisions, and Digital Sovereignty in Latin America
resources.description: An article examining how AI-driven, “invisible” decision systems are reshaping governance and digital sovereignty in Latin America. It highlights transparency, accountability, and regional cooperation challenges and policy implications, arguing that addressing these issues is essential to protect citizen rights, democratic oversight, and state control over digital infrastructure.

resources.title: Track b — YouTube video shared in cohort-3
resources.description: A YouTube link labeled "Track b" posted in the #cohort-3-text channel alongside "Track a" as part of a set called "Git tracks". It identifies the second shared track for the cohort and matters for members who need to reference or compare the paired tracks.

resources.title: TinyLlama 1.1B Chat v1.0 Hugging Face model
resources.description: Hugging Face repository for TinyLlama-1.1B-Chat-v1.0, a 1.1-billion-parameter chat-oriented language model. It matters because a smaller, chat-focused LLM is easier to experiment with and deploy on limited hardware, allowing faster inference, lower resource costs, and quicker iteration.

resources.title: BMAD framework for agent roles and traceability
resources.description: Overview of BMAD, a framework that defines clear specialized agent roles (Analyst, Product Manager, Architect, Orchestrator), preserves context via “Story Files,” and enforces traceability and compliance through versioning and audit trails. Relevant for implementing coordinated agent workflows on websites or embedding into business-model-canvas processes requiring auditability.

resources.title: Introducing AgentKit: OpenAI Developer Toolkit
resources.description: An introduction page for AgentKit, OpenAI’s new developer toolkit for building agent-based applications and workflows. It outlines the toolkit’s purpose and intended use cases. This matters because it provides a structured approach for integrating model-driven agents into products, shaping design, deployment, and governance choices.

resources.title: GitHub - czlonkowski/n8n-mcp: A MCP for Claude Desktop / Claude Code / Windsurf / Cursor to build n8n workflows for you
resources.description: n8n-mcp is an MCP integration for Claude Desktop, Claude Code, Windsurf, and Cursor that automatically generates, refactors, and validates n8n workflows from natural-language prompts. Use it to scaffold node sequences, configure credentials and triggers, produce JSON workflow exports, and run basic tests. Includes an MCP server component—see setup instructions at https://github.com/czlonkowski/n8n-mcp for installation, configuration, and usage examples.

resources.title: GitHub - ItzCrazyKns/Perplexica: Perplexica is an AI-powered answering engine. It is an Open source alternative to Perplexity AI
resources.description: Enhanced: Perplexica is an open-source, AI-powered answering engine that delivers concise, sourced responses by combining large language models with retrieval from the web and knowledge bases. Designed as a transparent, self-hostable alternative to Perplexity AI, it provides a conversational search interface, API-friendly integration, and verifiable citations and source links to make research and decision-making reproducible and auditable.

resources.title: GitHub - open-webui/open-webui: User-friendly AI Interface (Supports Ollama, OpenAI API, ...)
resources.description: Open WebUI is an extensible, self-hosted AI interface from the open-webui GitHub organization that runs entirely offline and supports multiple LLM runners (including Ollama and OpenAI-compatible APIs). It provides a built-in inference engine for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), modular integrations, and UI customization. The project targets developers, researchers, and ops teams building and deploying local or private LLM applications and workflows.

resources.title: Ollama GitHub — CLI for local LLM runtime
resources.description: The GitHub repository for Ollama, containing source code, installers, and command-line tools for running language models locally via a local runtime. It includes CLI commands, installation instructions, and model management code. Relevant because the cohort will install and use Ollama next week via the command line/installer.

resources.title: Command Line Crash Course For Beginners | Terminal Commands
resources.description: Learn to navigate the terminal across Windows, macOS, and Linux with a practical, OS-agnostic crash course tailored for beginners. Cover essential commands for files and directories (cd, ls/dir, cp, mv, rm), viewing and searching (cat, less, grep, find), pipes and redirection, permissions (chmod/chown), basic process management, keyboard shortcuts, and simple shell scripting (bash/PowerShell). Windows users get notes on Command Prompt vs PowerShell. For your own time: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uwAqEzhyjtw

resources.title: Install Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL)
resources.description: Microsoft Learn guide that explains how to install and set up the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) on Windows. It provides step-by-step installation and configuration instructions, distribution options, and basic troubleshooting so Windows users can run Linux command-line tools and development workflows for a similar Linux experience.

resources.title: Technological Optimism and Appropriate Fear
resources.description: An essay by Jack Clark examining the emotional and strategic tension in contemporary AI discourse, arguing for “technological optimism” balanced by “appropriate fear.” It matters for AI leaders because it frames risk-awareness and decision-making; the discussion has prompted practitioner reflections and frameworks (e.g., the PEACH framework) for operational practice.

resources.title: Anthropic Petri: Simulated AI-to-AI testing tool
resources.description: Anthropic’s Petri runs simulated conversations where AI agents test one another to detect risky or unusual behaviors before they reach users. It provides automated adversarial testing useful for AI safety research, but its findings still need careful human review because tester agents can overreact or miss context.

resources.title: OpenAI for Germany initiative and partnerships
resources.description: A page presenting OpenAI’s initiative for Germany, outlining its engagement, partnership approach, and local deployment considerations. It matters because it frames national AI localisation and sovereignty debates — including partnership-based infrastructure choices — and highlights potential implications for SMEs, costs, cloud lock-in, and the need for small-data, low-compute local models.

resources.title: Discord breach exposes government ID photos
resources.description: Hack of a third‑party vendor used for Discord’s age‑related appeals exposed sensitive data for about 70,000 users, including government ID photos. This matters because exposed identity documents and personal data can lead to privacy harms, identity fraud, and undermine trust in verification processes, with possible regulatory and legal fallout.

resources.title: Sam Altman on Sora, Energy, and Building an AI Empire
resources.description: Interview with Sam Altman about Sora, energy, and building an AI empire. The discussion examines strategic and technical aspects of developing AI products, implications for energy and infrastructure, and challenges of scaling AI organizations. Relevant for people following AI industry strategy, deployment trade-offs, and organizational growth.

resources.title: Fine-Tuning 7B LLMs on One GPU
resources.description: This Medium tutorial by Hamman Samuel covers installing Transformers, PEFT, and BitsAndBytes; choosing LoRA or QLoRA; formatting prompts; and running a training loop optimized to fine-tune a 7B model on a single GPU. It also demonstrates negative-example “guardrail” training to reduce over-generalization.

resources.title: Prompt Engineering Tutorial for Beginners (30 Minutes)
resources.description: Tutorial on prompt engineering for beginners from a Google course, teaching how to craft clear instructions and structure prompts for LLMs like ChatGPT and Gemini. Covers basics of AI prompts, step-by-step guidance, and essential tips to improve accuracy and creativity in outputs in under 30 minutes.

resources.title: AI maps how a new antibiotic targets gut bacteria
resources.description: News report on researchers using AI to map how a targeted antibiotic attacks harmful gut bacteria associated with Crohn's disease flare-ups while sparing beneficial microbes. In animal tests the treatment accelerated recovery, and the approach reduced projected drug-development time from years to months, demonstrating AI's potential to speed precision-medicine development.

resources.title: OpenAI DevDay 2025 — Advances in Applied AI
resources.description: Announcement of OpenAI DevDay 2025, an event on October 6 presenting advances in applied AI across models, platforms, governance, and security. The keynote and sessions aim to help organizations anticipate trends, align roadmaps, develop talent, and accelerate capacities for deploying AI.

resources.title: Perplexity’s Comet browser goes free worldwide
resources.description: Perplexity has released Comet, an AI-powered browser, to all users and removed its prior invite-only restriction. The company also added a background assistant feature for Max subscribers. Wider availability and an always-on assistant could change how people use browser-based AI and affect competition among AI browsing tools.

resources.title: Introducing Notion 3.0: Agents
resources.description: Assign tasks and your Agents do the work: Notion 3.0 Agents handle manual work like a teammate built into Notion. Share goals and watch them draft emails, summarize meetings, research topics, update databases, schedule follow-ups, and automate routine workflows across pages and boards. Customize instructions, monitor progress in-app, and reclaim hours by turning repetitive administrative work into reliable, automated actions.

resources.title: Prompt Engineering Guide for Life Sciences
resources.description: A distilled quick-start guide that condenses 58 prompt techniques into six core strategies (zero-shot, few-shot, thought generation, ensembling, self-criticism, decomposition) and shows how to combine them for life-science workflows such as literature review and data extraction. It also highlights multi-turn prompt pitfalls and model behavior drops teams should monitor.

resources.title: Developer Guide to Deploying LLM Applications
resources.description: A step-by-step playbook that guides developers from prompt prototyping to a production LLM service. It covers app architecture, RAG orchestration, security (secrets, input/output validation), reliability (retries, caching, rate limits), cost tracking, containerization, CI/CD, observability, prompt versioning, and A/B evaluation.

resources.title: Prompt-based Plain-language Simplification for Spanish LLMs
resources.description: ArXiv paper presenting methods to simplify Spanish text into plain language using prompt engineering (zero-shot) and lightweight LoRA fine-tuning on Spanish LLMs. It evaluates readability and semantic fidelity, and proposes normalization plus Spanish-specific prompt design to balance clarity with content retention, aiding accessibility with minimal model changes.

resources.title: OpenAI Introduces Parental Controls for ChatGPT
resources.description: Parental controls for ChatGPT from OpenAI explain features, setup steps, and underlying safety mechanisms for supervising young users. The page covers supervised accounts, content filters and moderation classifiers, age‑appropriate settings, usage limits, and family management tools, plus rollout and platform availability. Intended for parents, guardians, educators, and organizations evaluating ChatGPT use with children. Published by OpenAI with technical and policy-focused detail.

resources.title: Moving Peach AI agents to Azure and trust
resources.description: Medium post recounting the author's move of Peach AI agents to Microsoft Azure to host OpenAI models. It explains practical steps and compliance-focused reasoning for doing this in the EU, and reflects on trust, governance and how a non-technical practitioner is balancing regulatory requirements with AI-driven operations.

resources.title: GenSpark Photo Genius: Overview and Demo
resources.description: Video introduction to GenSpark Photo Genius, a new photo tool within GenSpark. Presents the tool’s capabilities and typical workflows so GenSpark users can assess how it might affect photo-editing or image-generation tasks and decide whether to adopt it in their existing workflows.

resources.title: OpenAI and NVIDIA 10 GW systems partnership
resources.description: Letter of intent for NVIDIA to deploy ≥10 GW of systems for OpenAI, with NVIDIA proposing up to $100B of phased investment and the first 1 GW arriving in H2 2026 on the Vera Rubin platform. This matters because it concentrates compute supply, affects pricing, energy and grid needs, and vendor dependence.

resources.title: 4 Free Methods to Use LLM APIs in Development
resources.description: Practical guide that explains four ways to use LLM APIs for development without costs, covering Ollama, GitHub Models, Open Router, and Groq. It explains local model hosting, using environment variables and a unified API endpoint to switch models easily—helpful for developers prototyping LLM features without paying cloud API fees.

resources.title: Frugal AI: Introduction, Concepts, Development and Open Questions
resources.description: The document is an introduction to Frugal AI, a concept that aims to reduce the energy consumption of artificial intelligence systems. The PDF discusses the development and open questions surrounding this field, including the use of machine learning algorithms, optimization techniques, and hardwa...

resources.title: Ted Cruz's AI Sandbox Bill Allows 10-Year Waivers
resources.description: Report on Senator Ted Cruz’s proposed SANDBOX Act, which would let AI companies obtain waivers from “obstructive regulations” for up to 10 years if they publish public safety and financial risk mitigation plans. The measure raises concerns about weakening consumer protections and enabling firms to bypass oversight, increasing risks of harm.

resources.title: Python Full Course for Beginners
resources.description: Learn Python for AI, machine learning, and web development in this beginner-friendly full course. Follow step-by-step lessons on fundamentals — variables, control flow, data structures, functions, object-oriented programming, file I/O and modules — with practical examples and mini-projects to build real-world skills. Includes an introduction to popular libraries for data and web tasks and a 6-month free PyCharm subscription (coupon in the video description).

resources.title: Advanced 2025 Guide to Prompt Engineering
resources.description: Tutorial on prompt engineering for large language models that advocates treating models as conversational partners, building complexity through iterative prompts, and specifying concrete negative constraints to avoid generic outputs. Demonstrates breaking complex prompts into multi-step conversations to improve result quality, relevant for developers and prompt designers.

resources.title: OpenAI Grove application draft page
resources.description: Web page for drafting an application to OpenAI Grove. It lets users start and prepare an application submission to OpenAI’s Grove initiative, serving as the entry point for proposals or requests for participation, access, or collaboration. Useful for anyone intending to apply or engage with OpenAI Grove.

resources.title: Prompt Engineering Cheat Sheet for GPT-5
resources.description: Article outlining nine prompt-engineering patterns for GPT-5 — including Persona, Few-Shot, Chain-of-Thought, and Structured Output — with practical Python examples using the OpenAI API. It shows how to apply these patterns to get more accurate, consistent, and machine-readable responses for code generation workflows.

resources.title: Guide to Prompt Engineering for Large Language Models
resources.description: A guide on designing clear, specific prompts for large language models, showing how to include context, explicit instructions, and examples to steer model behavior. It explains how prompt construction influences intent understanding and output, and why careful prompting improves the quality, relevance, and safety of generative AI responses.

resources.title: Ten examples of native image editing in Gemini app
resources.description: This post provides ten step-by-step prompts for Gemini's native image-editing features, covering style transfers, object changes and multi-photo blends. Each example shows what to upload and the exact prompt to run in the Gemini app, letting beginners reproduce edits without coding and learn the app's image transformation capabilities.

resources.title: NotebookLM training: features and workflows
resources.description: A YouTube training session demonstrating NotebookLM features and workflows. The recording walks through core functionality and typical workflows to help viewers understand how to use NotebookLM for organizing notes and supporting research or team knowledge tasks. Useful for anyone evaluating or onboarding to NotebookLM.

resources.title: FTC Seeks AI Companies' Data on Kids' Chatbots
resources.description: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission has ordered OpenAI, Meta, Snap, xAI, Alphabet, Instagram, and Character.AI to submit reports on how they assess risks to children and teens, user retention and monetization data, and internal studies on emotional impact. The action moves oversight from voluntary ethics toward mandated transparency and potential legal standards.

resources.title: Regulating AI: Balancing Innovation, Ethics, and Public Policy
resources.description: This SSRN paper examines global AI policy approaches—including the EU AI Act and U.S./China strategies—and analyzes ethical dilemmas like algorithmic bias, transparency, and job displacement. It highlights the challenge of aligning regulation with rapid technological innovation, aiding policymakers designing adaptable, ethics-driven AI frameworks.

resources.title: Anthropic Claude Creates and Edits Office Files
resources.description: Anthropic’s Claude can create and edit Excel, Word, PowerPoint and PDF files directly from chat or the desktop app, using a sandboxed environment for secure code execution. Rolling out in preview to Max, Team, and Enterprise (Pro soon), this reduces manual file work and streamlines document, report, and presentation creation.

resources.title: Guide to using generative AI for design
resources.description: A practical guide that shows how to use generative AI for rapid design ideation and iterative refinement. It explains directing AI with precise, film‑director–style prompts, treating outputs as rough concepts to be polished in tools like Photoshop or Illustrator, and recommends generating multiple concepts (e.g., 10) then refining one.

resources.title: Branch conversations in ChatGPT to test ideas
resources.description: A ChatGPT web feature that lets you "Branch in new chat" from any message to create parallel conversations for alternative prompts, tones, or instructions. It enables side-by-side A/B testing without cluttering the original thread, letting logged-in users compare outputs quickly and choose the best prompt or persona.

resources.title: Discord Discussion Resource for Prompt Writing Process
resources.description: A shared resource from an open forum discussion where users share their prompt writing process, including a base set of prompts available on PromptBase.com and experiences with using OpenAI's prompt optimizer. The conversation also invites participants to join a future open forum discussion.

resources.title: Azure Translator: Custom Translator Overview and Capabilities
resources.description: This Microsoft documentation page describes Azure Translator's Custom Translator, a service for training and deploying customized neural machine translation models using user-provided bilingual data, glossaries, and domain-specific examples. It explains workflow, supported formats, and deployment, enabling improved translation quality for domain-specific content and low-resource language scenarios.

resources.title: GenSpark.ai AI Designer demo: logo and 3D loops
resources.description: Demonstration of GenSpark.ai's new "AI Designer" mode, showing how to generate logos and 3D moving elements and create looped animated versions within minutes. Useful for brand-identity teams to prototype visual identities and motion assets quickly, speeding up concept exploration and iteration.

resources.title: Local LLM API with FastAPI and Ollama
resources.description: Step-by-step tutorial showing how to build a local REST API in Python using FastAPI and Ollama to serve open-source LLMs (e.g., LLaMA) on your machine. Covers environment setup, running Ollama, creating API endpoints and testing via HTTP requests—useful for self-hosted model serving, privacy, and avoiding cloud dependencies.

resources.title: Threat Intelligence Report:
resources.description: Anthropic's August 2025 Threat Intelligence Report documents real-world misuse of its Claude model, presenting multiple case studies—AI coding agents enabling large-scale data extortion, North Korean remote-worker fraud, no-code ransomware-as-a-service, a Chinese actor using Claude across MITRE ATT&CK tactics, stealer-log analysis, AI-powered carding, romance-scam bots, and synthetic identity services. It outlines detection measures and mitigation steps, making it a practical resource for security teams and policymakers.

resources.title: Gemini 2.5 Flash Image ("Nano Banana") Demo
resources.description: Demo of Google's Gemini 2.5 Flash Image ("Nano Banana"), an image-editing model built into the Gemini app. It does person replacement, object insertion, clothing/hairstyle changes and day-to-night scene edits from text prompts; free users get 100 edits per day. It streamlines complex edits and can feed into motion workflows.

resources.title: AI Alignment Is a Battle: Clashing Values Decide Future
resources.description: Article arguing that a single universal AI ethical framework is unrealistic because human values conflict across cultures and interests. It contends AI development will involve competing value-aligned systems shaping outcomes through conflict and competition, highlighting the need to design mechanisms that encourage constructive inter-AI competition while minimizing risks to humanity.

resources.title: The GenAI Divide
resources.description: This 2025 industry report examines enterprise GenAI adoption, based on a systematic review of 300 disclosed AI initiatives, 52 structured interviews, and surveys of 153 senior leaders. It documents a "GenAI Divide"—claiming 95% of organizations see no measurable ROI—analyzes why pilots stall (a learning gap), and gives practical recommendations for builders and buyers to scale GenAI and capture value.

resources.title: Prompt Engineering 2025: Crafting ChatGPT Prompts
resources.description: A Medium guide explaining prompt engineering techniques for ChatGPT in 2025, arguing that 90% of AI frustration stems from poor prompts. It covers role assignment, contextual detail, exact output formatting, step-by-step prompting and few-shot examples, and recommends role-playing (e.g., "You are a [expert role]...") to improve responses.

resources.title: OpenAI ChatGPT users mourn GPT-5 '4o' update
resources.description: News article reporting user reactions to OpenAI’s rollout of the ChatGPT model labelled "GPT-5" or "4o", documenting how people adjusted prompting and expressed nostalgia for model 4. It matters because those user experiences affect prompt design, daily workflows, and wider adoption of the new model.

resources.title: The GenAI Divide: State of AI in Business 2025
resources.description: A 2025 MIT NANDA report titled "The GenAI Divide: State of AI in Business 2025" examining generative AI's role in business. It assesses industry adoption and implications for markets and investors; its release reportedly affected market activity. Access may require affiliation or site approval, limiting public availability.

resources.title: Bill Maher interview on AI controllability
resources.description: A recorded interview with Bill Maher discussing AI controllability, exploring risks, governance, and societal implications. The conversation examines how to keep advanced systems aligned with human values and the policy, technical, and ethical questions that arise. Relevant for those interested in AI safety, regulation, and public debate.

resources.title: Fine-Tuning LLMs: Three Practical Approaches
resources.description: Article detailing three practical methods for fine-tuning large language models — full-parameter tuning, instruction tuning, and LoRA — and guidance on choosing between them based on needs. It matters because selecting the appropriate method affects model reliability on complex tasks and stylistic alignment; suggests experimenting with LoRA on a small domain-specific dataset.

resources.title: Running Local LLMs on an M3 MacBook
resources.description: Medium article offering a practical guide to running large language models locally on an M3 MacBook using the MLX-LM library. It explains loading quantized models to improve performance on consumer hardware and emphasizes benefits such as avoiding paid API costs and keeping data local, enabling tighter cost control and privacy.

resources.title: Prototyping AI Apps with Claude Artifacts
resources.description: Guide on using Claude Artifacts to prototype AI-powered applications without managing API keys, deployment costs, or rate limits. By enabling "Create AI powered artifacts" in Claude settings, users can have Claude integrate its API into apps—enabling chatbots, learning tools, content generators, and analysis apps that can be shared for rapid prototyping.

resources.title: Bright Data and n8n Real-time AI Agent Challenge
resources.description: A DEV-hosted Real-time AI Agent Challenge run by Bright Data and n8n, active through August 31 with $5,000 USD in cash prizes. The event includes an n8n live building session (link shared). It’s an opportunity for developers to build and showcase real-time AI agents using n8n and Bright Data.

resources.title: Building a Website Using Prompts Only (Live)
resources.description: Live walkthrough demonstrating how to build a website using only prompts, and showcasing two custom GPTs: L.D GEN (Lovable) and Agent Prompter. The video includes additional integration steps for Lovable and the ChatGPT Agent Tool that were not finished on stream, with download links in the YouTube description.

resources.title: GPT-5 Now Default in ChatGPT
resources.description: Announcement that GPT-5 is now the default model in ChatGPT, adding a built-in "Thinking" mode for complex tasks such as coding, research, and financial analysis. The update also provides higher usage limits and manual access to GPT-5 Thinking, affecting technical workflows and handling larger or more complex queries.

resources.title: Google Med-Gemini "Basilar Ganglia" Paper Error
resources.description: The Verge reported that Google’s Med-Gemini system produced a reference to an “old left basilar ganglia infarct” — a nonexistent anatomical term — in a research paper and blog post prior to edits. The mistake highlights risks of AI hallucinations and automation bias when generative models are used in clinical workflows.

resources.title: DeepEval LLM Evaluation Framework (GitHub)
resources.description: Open-source GitHub repository providing DeepEval, a Pytest-like framework for unit testing LLM outputs. It supplies evaluation metrics — including G-Eval, hallucination detection, and answer relevancy — to help developers identify erroneous generations and measure response quality. Useful for integrating automated tests into LLM development workflows.

resources.title: LoRA Fine-Tuning LLMs on Custom Data
resources.description: Tutorial on fine-tuning pre-trained LLMs using custom datasets with Hugging Face Transformers and PEFT (LoRA). It shows an efficient, low-VRAM workflow to teach a model new information and produce a customized model that adopts the provided data—useful for adding domain-specific facts or behavior without full-model retraining.

resources.title: OpenAI HealthBench medical model evaluation benchmark
resources.description: An OpenAI benchmark and scoring framework for evaluating large language models on healthcare tasks. HealthBench reports model performance across overall and “Hard” subsets, physician-validated consensus rubrics, hallucination and urgent-scenario error rates, and global-health tests—data used to compare models’ clinical accuracy and safety.

resources.title: Prep video for next week's meeting
resources.description: A short preparatory video linked in the message that briefs participants on items to be discussed in next week's meeting. Watching will familiarize you with the updates and context, so you can follow the discussion and review the rough preview shared separately before the meeting.

resources.title: Transmisión en directo
resources.description: Transmisión en directo: retransmisiones en vivo y eventos públicos organizados por OpenAI y la OpenAI Foundation. Cubre presentaciones, demostraciones de modelos de IA (incluidos modelos de lenguaje), debates sobre seguridad y políticas de IA, y sesiones de preguntas y respuestas. Está dirigido a investigadores, desarrolladores, responsables de políticas, periodistas y público interesado en inteligencia artificial. Contenido producido por OpenAI con presentadores e investigadores afiliados.

resources.title: Using large language models to generate silicon samples in consumer and marketing research: Challenges, opportunities, and guidelines
resources.description: This review article examines using large language models to generate "silicon" respondent samples for consumer and marketing research. It synthesizes empirical comparisons between synthetic and human data, provides concrete recommendations and guidelines (especially for qualitative pretesting and pilot studies), critically assesses suitability for main studies, addresses ethical concerns, and outlines future research avenues.

resources.title: LLM Learning Journey: Prompt Engineering Day 2
resources.description: A Medium post where the author builds a study-buddy app (Flask + React + Ollama) to compare prompt strategies—one-shot, few-shot, chain-of-thought, meta prompting, tree-of-thought, self-consistency, and RAG chaining. It demonstrates how different prompting techniques affect speed, accuracy and consistency in a controlled setup.

resources.title: AI-Detected Helmet Leads to Recovery of Missing Hiker
resources.description: In July 2025 the Italian Alpine Rescue Corps used AI to analyze 2,600 drone images across 183 hectares and detected a red helmet, locating a hiker missing since September 2024 within three days. The case shows how AI color-and-shape recognition can speed searches in rugged terrain and shorten search times.

resources.title: Claude Flow: Framework for agent swarm workflows
resources.description: GitHub repository with code and workflow components for orchestrating multiple Claude-based agents as "swarms". It provides a framework to prototype, coordinate, and run collaborative LLM agent interactions and automated multi-agent workflows. This matters because it makes experimenting with collective agent behaviors and parallelized prompt workflows faster and more reproducible.

resources.title: Curated list of 120+ LLM libraries
resources.description: This GitHub repository by KalyanKS collects 120+ libraries and tools for LLM workflows, covering training, fine-tuning, building, evaluation, deployment, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and AI agents. Shared by Eduardo Ordax, it serves as a practical reference for developers and researchers to find libraries across LLM development and production tasks.

resources.title: ChatGPT Study Mode: Study Guides, Flashcards, Quizzes
resources.description: ChatGPT Study Mode provides study guides, flashcards, and quizzes generated by OpenAI’s ChatGPT to support learning. It covers automated creation and practice materials across subjects and proficiency levels, leveraging generative AI and large language model capabilities to format summaries, question sets, and review prompts. Intended for students, educators, and self‑directed learners, the resource is published and maintained by OpenAI.

resources.title: Anatomy of a Prompt: Seven-Layer Prompting Guide
resources.description: Article outlining a seven-layer prompt framework—Role, Goal, Format, Warnings, Context, Examples, and Reasoning—and explains how layering these elements reduces hallucinations, verbosity, and style drift. Backed by studies from OpenAI, Google Cloud, Anthropic and others, it reports double-digit improvements in factual accuracy and consistency; recommends rewriting prompts to apply the layers.

resources.title: How to Use GenAI as a Sparring Partner
resources.description: A practical method for using ChatGPT with uploaded reports (e.g., market research PDFs) to run structured Q&A sessions that iteratively challenge and refine business ideas. It matters because the process extracts report insights, surfaces assumptions, and provides feedback to improve problem-solving and decision-making.

resources.title: Agentic AI Total Addressable Market Analysis
resources.description: Analysis by Google Cloud estimating agentic AI's total addressable market and adoption projections, including a $1 trillion market potential by 2040 and >90% enterprise adoption within three years. Describes agentic AI capabilities, integration with 80+ business apps, sector impacts, and implications for leadership, ethics, governance and human oversight.

resources.title: Delve raises $32M at $300M valuation
resources.description: Delve, founded by 21-year-old MIT dropouts, raised $32 million at a $300 million valuation in a round led by Insight. The company builds autonomous AI agents to automate regulatory compliance tasks, aiming to reduce manual review and scale compliance operations for regulated businesses, potentially lowering cost and speeding regulatory responses.

resources.title: EchoNext Library: ECG AI for Structural Heart Disease
resources.description: Columbia researchers' EchoNext Library provides de-identified ECG datasets, preprocessing code, and mini‑model weights for detecting structural heart disease from ECGs. Researchers and developers can run the model on local ECG data, benchmark performance (reported ~77% accuracy, AUROC ≈0.90), and support validation and adaptation of AI cardiac screening.

resources.title: Wired review: ElliQ AI companion robot
resources.description: A Wired review of ElliQ, an AI companion robot designed to proactively engage older adults. The article examines how ElliQ interacts with seniors to address loneliness and foster individualized social connections, and why such proactive robotic companions could influence senior wellbeing and the role of technology in elder care.

resources.title: San José GovAI Coalition Employee AI Training Playlist
resources.description: A YouTube playlist compiling San José city’s GovAI training sessions developed with San José State University to upskill municipal employees in practical AI use. It documents local-government approaches to workforce AI education and algorithm governance, relevant for other public-sector organizations designing internal learning pathways and AI culture.

resources.title: Using Custom GPTs on Your Website
resources.description: Forum post explaining that OpenAI’s web interface has no native embed/widget for custom GPTs. Advises creating a duplicate "twin" of the custom GPT on the OpenAI API platform and serving it via the API so you can integrate the model into an external website—useful for developers needing site-level access.

resources.title: ChatGPT Agents Released to Pro Users July 17
resources.description: Update on the ChatGPT agents rollout: the video reports the feature was released to Pro users on July 17, with Plus and Teams accounts slated next and general availability expected by the end of the month. Useful for users tracking when agents will become accessible across subscription tiers and for planning integrations.

resources.title: Introducing ChatGPT Agents: tools, files, and actions
resources.description: OpenAI's announcement of ChatGPT Agents describes new agent capabilities: using external tools, browsing user files, and performing actions on users' behalf to execute multi-step plans. These agents enable automation of complex tasks (for example, assisting with launching a startup), potentially changing how conversational AI carries out workflows.

resources.title: ChatGPT agent Makes Spreadsheets
resources.description: Enhanced: Good morning all — ChatGPT agent automatically fetches data from APIs, databases, or CSVs, then generates polished spreadsheets (XLSX/CSV) with formulas, pivot tables, charts, conditional formatting, and summaries. It schedules recurring runs (hourly/daily/weekly) with OAuth-secured access, exports to Google Drive, email, or shared links, sends notifications, and supports customizable templates for reporting and KPIs. Demo: https://youtu.be/JAQ4p662It8?si=UJZxuvVItIBr5yzr

resources.title: Dr. ChatGPT Will See You Now
resources.description: Patients and clinicians are increasingly using large language models like ChatGPT for diagnoses, triage and treatment recommendations—sometimes producing rapid, accurate, even lifesaving guidance. But as AI systems deliver confident, plausible-sounding errors, conflicts with medical experts, regulatory gaps, liability questions and opaque reasoning expose real risks: misdiagnosis, inappropriate treatments and erosion of clinical trust when algorithms and doctors disagree.

resources.title: Anthropic Introduction to AI Fluency online course
resources.description: A free introductory online course from Anthropic on AI fluency that offers a certificate of completion. It covers foundational ideas about AI and why fluency matters, helping learners understand AI capabilities, limitations, and how to interact with AI systems responsibly.

resources.title: AI and Longevity: Affordability Risks
resources.description: Research report from MIT AgeLab and Bank of America (Nov 2023) examining how advances in AI-driven healthcare may extend lifespans while simultaneously displacing jobs, creating affordability challenges for longer retirements. It highlights potential increases in inequality and raises policy questions about basic income and retirement support.

resources.title: New AI Tools for Mental-Health Research and Treatment
resources.description: A Google Blog post describing a practical field guide and a multi-year research partnership deploying AI to scale evidence-based mental-health interventions and to develop new treatments for anxiety, depression, and psychosis. The initiative pairs clinician-facing tools with sustained research funding, aiming to expand access to quality mental-health care for underserved populations.

resources.title: California task force report on AI risks
resources.description: Article covering a California state-led task force report (commissioned by Governor Newsom) warning that rapid AI advances could enable bioweapon development, strategic deception, and other misuse. It urges transparency, third-party audits, and whistleblower protections. Important because California’s proposals aim to fill federal regulatory gaps and could shape or fragment US AI governance.

resources.title: ChatGPT Front-End for Cardiac Risk Prediction
resources.description: Walkthrough building a 92%-accurate logistic regression model that predicts heart-disease risk from 17 lifestyle and medical variables, then layering ChatGPT as a conversational front end. ChatGPT maps free-text patient descriptions into the model’s structured feature vector and returns an instant risk score, demonstrating conversational cardiac-triage workflows.

resources.title: Guide to Building a Healthcare AI Agent
resources.description: Medium (Thinkitive Inc., June 25, 2025) walkthrough describing how to scope and build a custom healthcare AI agent. It covers mapping existing workflows, ranking pain points, selecting an LLM and vector store, prototyping, HIPAA-safe sandbox testing, iteration, and planning for EHR integration. Includes checklists from data preparation to monitoring and a low-risk pilot suggestion.

resources.title: India's AI and Satellite Mapping of Urban Heat Vulnerability
resources.description: Report on Indian researchers and nonprofits using AI with satellite imagery to map heat vulnerability at the building level, focusing on low-income neighborhoods. The maps enable targeted interventions—public cooling shelters, water stations, adjusted work hours—and provide cities data to prioritize resources and protect vulnerable populations as temperatures rise.

resources.title: MidJourney Hyper‑Realistic Life Stages Animation
resources.description: A YouTube Short showing seven hyper-realistic images of the same person across different life stages, animated using MidJourney. Prompts were generated with ChatGPT, frames compiled in ShotCut and set to original music. Demonstrates combining generative-image prompts, MJ animation, and basic video editing; notes subscription requirement.

resources.title: Unpacking the 10-Year Moratorium on State AI Laws
resources.description: A Substack article summarizing the proposed 10-year moratorium on US state AI laws that the Senate recently rejected. Explains the moratorium's scope and potential effects on state-level AI regulation, and why its rejection matters for policymakers, industry compliance, and the pace of AI governance across states.

resources.title: Amazon deploys 1 millionth warehouse robot; unveils DeepFleet
resources.description: Report on Amazon reaching one million warehouse robots and launching "DeepFleet," a generative AI model that improves robot routing efficiency by about 10%. It shows large-scale generative AI applied to physical operations, potentially increasing automation in logistics and manufacturing and raising workforce, efficiency, and supply-chain risk considerations.

resources.title: Congress may block state AI laws for five years
resources.description: The TechCrunch article covers a budget-bill amendment backed by Sen. Ted Cruz that would bar states and cities from regulating AI systems for five years. Supporters, including OpenAI’s Sam Altman, say a single national framework avoids a patchwork; critics warn it strips consumer protections and pre-empts California’s AB 2013. A Senate vote is imminent.

resources.title: Prompt Migration Guide for GPT-4.1
resources.description: Interactive notebook that helps upgrade legacy prompts to GPT-4.1 by letting you paste an existing prompt, have the model identify ambiguities, auto-generate a clearer system prompt, and iterate on evaluations. It matters because explicitly surfacing every instruction improves model adherence and reduces unexpected or ambiguous outputs.

resources.title: Heygen product story using AI avatar
resources.description: A Heygen video experiment where the creator uses an AI avatar to tell a product story instead of a personal avatar. It shares lessons on selecting avatars—balancing vocal authenticity, lip sync, and natural movement—and notes that minimal hand gestures and tighter framing helped reduce distraction.

resources.title: Guide to Prompt Engineering for LLMs and VLMs
resources.description: Hands-on Medium guide on designing prompts for text-only and multimodal (VLM) models, covering zero-shot, few-shot, and chain-of-thought techniques with practical examples. It emphasizes structured prompts and delimiter use to improve model accuracy and reduce hallucinations, and suggests trying chain-of-thought prompting for complex queries.

resources.title: Measuring AI: DX AI Measurement Framework
resources.description: This vendor whitepaper presents the DX AI Measurement Framework™ for assessing AI code assistants and agents. It defines AI-specific metrics for adoption, usage, and impact, shows how to combine them with DX Core 4 engineering-productivity measures, and offers practical measurement methods and dashboards. Includes case studies (Booking.com, Block) and implementation guidance—useful for engineering leaders measuring AI tool ROI, but is vendor-backed.

resources.title: Your Brain on ChatGPT: Accumulation of Cognitive Debt when Using an AI Assistant for Essay Writing Task
resources.description: Using EEG, NLP (NERs, n‑grams, topic ontology), human teacher and AI scoring, 54 participants completed three sessions as LLM-assisted, Search Engine–assisted, or Brain-only writers; 18 completed a fourth session with LLM-to-Brain and Brain-to-LLM swaps. NLP showed within-group linguistic homogeneity. Brain-only writers exhibited the strongest, most distributed alpha/beta connectivity; Search users showed intermediate engagement; LLM users had weakest connectivity, lower ownership, poorer quoting, and reduced linguistic and neural performance over four months—raising educational concerns.

resources.title: Quickstart: Vertex AI express mode API tutorial
resources.description: Quickstart tutorial that shows how to install the google-genai SDK, initialize it with an API key, and send non‑streaming, streaming, and function‑calling requests to the Gemini model via Vertex AI express mode. It matters because it provides a minimal, hands‑on setup for developers to start making streaming and function‑enabled Gemini API calls.

resources.title: Tutorial: GraphRAG and Ollama for Local Q&A
resources.description: A step-by-step Medium tutorial demonstrating how small businesses can run Mistral-7B locally with Ollama and integrate it into a GraphRAG pipeline. It covers pulling models, indexing PDFs/CSVs into a lightweight Neo4j graph, and exposing a simple API for grounded natural-language Q&A—enabling on-premise querying without cloud costs and preserving data privacy.

resources.title: Anthropic Prompt Engineering Interactive Tutorial (GitHub)
resources.description: An Anthropic-authored interactive tutorial on prompt engineering for large language models, hosted as a GitHub repository with a public-access Google Sheets copy. It provides structured exercises and examples to practice prompt design and understanding, useful for learning practical techniques to improve LLM responses.

resources.title: Disney and Universal Sue Midjourney AI Image Generator
resources.description: A Wired news article reporting that Disney and Universal have sued Midjourney, the AI image generator, over alleged use of studio-owned copyrighted material. The lawsuit could set legal precedent for how generative AI handles copyrighted works and affect rights, business models, and content creation across entertainment and AI sectors.

resources.title: Building AI Agents with the OpenAI Agents SDK
resources.description: This Medium tutorial shows how to build goal-oriented, tool-enabled agents using OpenAI’s official Agents SDK. It covers agent creation, integrating tools, multi-step planning, adding memory and guardrails, and orchestrating workflows that perform actions beyond chat, helping developers retain context across steps.

resources.title: OpenAI Status Page — Current Service Outages
resources.description: Official OpenAI status page reporting current platform incidents and outages. It provides real-time updates, affected services, incident timelines, and progress on restorations. Useful for developers and teams relying on OpenAI APIs and services to understand availability, diagnose failed requests, and plan mitigations during reported outages.

resources.title: Teaching AI Models to Sketch Like Humans
resources.description: CSAIL research demonstrating methods for training AI models to produce sketch-like drawings that use incremental, uncertain, and interpretable decision steps. The paper examines how models mimic human sketching processes, which could inform generative agent design where stepwise, explainable outputs aid trust, debugging, and alignment in B2B or creative workflows.

resources.title: CLIP: Barriers to AI in Financial Services
resources.description: A Medium article examining CLIP — the barriers to unlocking AI’s real potential in financial services. It outlines the main obstacles that limit AI deployment in banks and financial firms and explains why addressing them matters for safe, compliant adoption, improved operational performance, and capturing AI-driven business value.

resources.title: 101 Generative AI Use Cases from Industry Leaders
resources.description: A Google Cloud compilation (Apr 9, 2025) listing 101 generative AI use cases and over 600 real-world applications across sectors such as healthcare, finance, and retail. It documents practical implementations and operational benefits, useful for identifying adoption patterns, potential efficiency gains, and adaptation ideas for organizations evaluating generative AI deployments.

resources.title: Build an Open-Source RAG App with Milvus and Hugging Face
resources.description: This tutorial shows how to build a retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) app by running a local Milvus vector database, chunking documents, creating Hugging Face embeddings, and feeding retrieved passages into an LLM prompt. Includes a runnable Colab notebook and advice on tuning top-k and adding a reranker to improve answer accuracy.

resources.title: MCP and RAG for SME Data Integration
resources.description: Article explains how pairing Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) lets SMEs stream live company data into small open-source LLMs without full retraining. Two pilot firms reported 45% fewer hallucinations and fine‑tuning costs under $25, suggesting improved factuality and lower deployment expense for SME AI systems.

resources.title: Periodic Table of Machine Learning Algorithms
resources.description: News article presenting a "periodic table" that organizes more than 20 classical machine-learning algorithms by their structural relationships. The framework highlights how methods connect and how researchers might fuse strategies to improve existing models or develop new ones. It matters because this perspective can guide systematic exploration and algorithmic innovation.

resources.title: Rick Rubin on Art, Life, and Vibe Coding
resources.description: Interview with Rick Rubin about "vibe coding" and his project The Way of Code (co-created with Anthropic's Claude AI). He reflects on creativity, why AI can't replicate an artist's evolving point of view, the role of letting go and mistakes, and how AI can function as a collaborative creative partner.

resources.title: REPORT 2025
resources.description: This UNDP Human Development Report examines AI's implications for people's lives and possibilities, analyzing how policy choices shape outcomes. It reviews effects on labour markets, inequality, public services, governance, and human rights; presents data, country case studies, scenarios, and measurement approaches; and offers policy recommendations to promote inclusive, equitable AI-driven development. Useful for researchers, policymakers, and educators seeking evidence-based guidance.

resources.title: Not what you've signed up for: Compromising Real-World LLM-Integrated Applications with Indirect Prompt Injection
resources.description: Paper introduces "Indirect Prompt Injection", a novel attack class against LLM-integrated applications where adversaries hide malicious prompts in retrievable data. It presents a security-focused taxonomy (data theft, worming, ecosystem contamination), demonstrates practical exploits against real systems (Bing's GPT-4 chat, code-completion engines) and synthetic GPT-4 apps, and analyzes how retrieved prompts can cause code execution and control API behavior—valuable for researchers and defenders.

resources.title: Anthropic announces two Claude 4 models
resources.description: Announcement of two new Claude 4 models from Anthropic that add hybrid reasoning (extended thinking plus tool use), improved sustained performance on complex, long-running tasks, and better memory with larger context windows. These changes target workflows requiring continuity and complex reasoning, but the update notes higher pricing, so cost matters.

resources.title: ChatGPT's performance has gotten much worse since May 5, 2025
resources.description: Since May 5, 2025 ChatGPT's quality has noticeably declined on web and mobile: conversations now often produce irrelevant, generic, or incorrect replies, lose context after a few turns, and sometimes require deleting the chat and starting a new conversation to get a correct response. Response times and repetition have worsened. I used to get accurate answers in one click; now I must reset repeatedly. Any fix or explanation would help.

resources.title: Unspecified Interview Shared by Group Member
resources.description: A YouTube interview link shared in the channel; the sender says they’re listening and invites others to check it out. The post does not state the interview topic or participants. It matters because group members can review the conversation, discuss its points, and contribute ideas or feedback.

resources.title: SSRN Study on ChatGPT (German)
resources.description: A scholarly working paper in German about ChatGPT, hosted on SSRN. It reports research and analysis concerning ChatGPT’s behavior, applications, and implications for German-speaking users. The study matters for researchers, developers, and policymakers seeking empirical or theoretical evidence about conversational AI performance, risks, and local-language considerations.

resources.title: Pepe bot GitHub repository invitations
resources.description: Invitation page for the private jcordovilla/pepe-bot repository. The sender added the listed users as collaborators; the repo remains private to protect the database. The bot runs as a background worker on Render and can be tested in Discord via the /pepe command by users with the specified role permissions.

resources.title: Bubble.io Core Concepts Made Simple
resources.description: A Medium article providing an introductory overview of Bubble.io for people new to the platform. It outlines the platform’s fundamental concepts and workflows, helping newcomers understand how to structure apps and begin building and prototyping no-code web applications.

resources.title: AI Was Built by Men for Men
resources.description: An opinion essay arguing that AI systems reflect male-dominated design choices and priorities, examining how that influences system behavior, representation, and user impacts. It matters because it highlights gender-based blind spots in AI development, informing discussions about fairness, inclusivity, and the need for diversified teams and governance.

resources.title: Block built Goose AI agent to boost productivity
resources.description: Report on Block's open-source "Goose" — an AI agent framework the company used to automate code generation, enable non-engineers to prototype, and build an agent-to-agent communication server during a hackathon. Goose runs commands, accesses files, integrates external tools, supports multiple models, and uses the Model Context Protocol.

resources.title: Goose: Block's open-source AI agent
resources.description: Open-source autonomous agent by Block that runs commands, accesses local files, and integrates with various AI models and online tools. Used internally to accelerate code writing and build an agent-to-agent communication server; its Model Context Protocol compatibility enables tool access and multi-agent coordination, aiding prototyping and non-engineer experimentation.

resources.title: Absolute Zero: Reinforced Self-play Reasoning with Zero Data
resources.description: This arXiv research paper presents "Absolute Zero," a reinforcement-learning-with-verifiable-rewards paradigm where a model (AbsoluteZeroReasoner, AZR) self-generates programming and math tasks, uses a code executor to validate tasks and answers, and trains without any external human-curated data. It details curriculum innovation, implementation and experiments that claim SOTA coding and mathematical reasoning versus other zero-data baselines, and discusses scalable autonomous training implications.

resources.title: MCP in LangChain Agents — When It Fits, When It Doesn't
resources.description: Analysis of where MCP is appropriate for LangChain agents and where it isn't. The article provides practical guidance for developers using LangChain or LangGraph, outlining trade-offs, decision criteria, and implementation considerations to help choose agent patterns and make more reliable agent decisions.

resources.title: Bloomberg report on Stargate project — 45 minutes
resources.description: A 45-minute Bloomberg reportage providing up-to-date coverage of the Stargate project, presenting recent developments and context. It matters for people following the project's progress and public impacts, offering journalistic synthesis useful for policymakers, researchers, and observers wanting a current overview of related events and decisions.

resources.title: AI and the Welsh Economy: Can Welsh androids dream of electric sheep?
resources.description: This Senedd Economy, Trade and Rural Affairs Committee report (May 2025) analyses AI’s likely impacts on the Welsh economy. It synthesises stakeholder evidence on sectoral opportunities and risks (manufacturing, public services, agriculture, technology), workforce and skills gaps, digital infrastructure, governance and regulation. The report sets out targeted recommendations for Welsh Government on investment, skills programmes, ethical frameworks and measures to support regional adoption and mitigate displacement.

resources.title: Prompt Engineering with Spring Boot and LLMs
resources.description: Tutorial showing how to integrate LLMs into a Spring Boot application using Spring AI and a custom ChatClient. It presents ten prompting strategies and implementation examples in a Java backend, helping developers apply prompt engineering techniques to improve AI-driven features and interactions in server-side applications.

resources.title: Absolute Zero model repository (Hugging Face)
resources.description: Link to the Absolute Zero model repository on Hugging Face tied to paper 2505.03335. It directs to the project's resources—such as model files, code, and documentation—needed to reproduce, run, or evaluate the model, useful for developers and researchers seeking to inspect or integrate the work.

resources.title: Design Is Entering Its Most Strategic Era
resources.description: Substack essay arguing that design is becoming a core strategic function as teams operationalize responsible AI, embrace collaborative multimodal workflows, and translate complex systems for broader audiences. It frames AI literacy as part of social responsibility and highlights design leadership’s role in implementing and communicating AI-driven change.

resources.title: The Future of AI Alignment: Meeting as Equals
resources.description: Essay arguing that AI alignment should move from control-based models to collaborative, reciprocal processes in which humans and AI co-develop ethical understanding. It emphasizes mutual trust, psychological safety, and continuous ethical engagement, and matters because it reframes safety practices and raises questions about ceding control to autonomous systems.

resources.title: Cognify: Hierarchical Autotuning for Gen-AI Workflows
resources.description: A framework using adaptive hierarchical search to automatically tune generative AI workflows by optimizing structure, operators, and prompts. It improves generation quality, reduces execution costs and latency, and automates tuning to simplify development and deployment of complex generative-AI applications and pipelines.

resources.title: List of Prompt Engineering Courses 2025
resources.description: Curated roundup listing 10 prompt engineering courses (eight described as interactive, hands‑on). Covers zero- and few‑shot techniques, chain‑of‑thought workflows, and tool integrations. Each entry notes estimated completion time, example exercises, and community support channels, useful for learners choosing a course and completing practical prompting work.

resources.title: The Impact of Generative AI on Critical Thinking: Self-Reported Reductions in Cognitive Effort and Confidence Effects From a Survey of Knowledge Workers
resources.description: This paper reports a mixed-methods survey of 319 knowledge workers (936 first‑hand task examples) examining how Generative AI affects critical thinking in professional workflows. Quantitatively, it finds users' task-specific self-confidence increases enacted critical thinking while confidence in GenAI predicts reduced effort. Qualitatively, GenAI shifts critical thinking toward verification, response integration, and task stewardship, and discusses design implications.

resources.title: HERMES: AI public health kiosk for OTC recommendations
resources.description: HERMES is an AI-driven public health kiosk that gives personalized over-the-counter medication recommendations from self-reported symptoms and anonymized medical histories. It preserves privacy via federated learning and supports multilingual voice interaction and Braille interfaces, enabling accessible, on-site health guidance in public settings and reducing barriers to basic care.

resources.title: Trust, attitudes and use of artificial intelligence
resources.description: Collaborative 2025 global research report by the University of Melbourne and KPMG presenting survey-based findings on public and organisational trust, attitudes and actual use of AI. It summarises methodological details, regional and demographic breakdowns, drivers of trust, common use-cases, risks and governance implications, and practical recommendations for policymakers and business leaders. Useful for researchers, regulators and executives seeking evidence-based insights into AI acceptance and governance.

resources.title: KPMG Report: Trust in AI Usage and Applications
resources.description: A global report by KPMG and University of Melbourne examining trust attitudes towards AI usage, cultural differences, and essential guardrails for establishing trust. This study highlights the importance of accountability, transparency, and accurate use of AI to foster public trust.

resources.title: Integrating Cognitive Signals into Language Models
resources.description: ArXiv preprint (Lopez-Cardona et al., Apr 2025) proposing integration of cognitive processing signals (e.g., eye-tracking) into language models to align attention and comprehension with humans. Reports potential benefits: improved data efficiency, faster training convergence, enhanced interpretability, and reduced hallucinations in multimodal tasks such as visual question answering.

resources.title: GitHub - kogsio/genaiglobal: Website for Gen-AI Global
resources.description: Gen-AI Global's open-source website provides community news, events, project showcases, resources, and documentation for developers and researchers. The repository contains site content, assets, and contribution guidelines—perfect for adding pages, improving design, accessibility, or translations. Contribute by forking the repo, creating a GitHub account, opening issues, or submitting pull requests at https://github.com/kogsio/genaiglobal

resources.title: Replit official step-by-step visual walkthrough
resources.description: An official Replit video that provides a visual, step-by-step walkthrough of the procedure mentioned in the chat. It demonstrates the interface and sequence of actions so visual learners can follow along, reproduce the steps, and clarify parts that are harder to convey in written, numbered instructions.

resources.title: SimplifyMyText: LLM-Based Plain-Language Text Simplification System
resources.description: An LLM-powered system that converts complex texts into plain-language versions in five languages, available at simplifymytext.org. The paper presents design and evaluation challenges—simplifying without altering meaning—and emphasizes user-tailored outputs to reduce comprehension barriers and support inclusive communication across diverse literacy and linguistic populations.

resources.title: RAG LLMs are Not Safer: A Safety Analysis of Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Large Language Models
resources.description: Many AI-safety efforts—fine-tuning, evaluation, and red teaming—target standalone LLMs, but Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is widely deployed and understudied. We present a comparative safety analysis of RAG versus non‑RAG setups across eleven LLMs and find RAG can reduce safety and qualitatively alter a model’s risk profile. Even safe models paired with safe documents can produce unsafe outputs, and common red‑teaming methods are less effective for RAG, highlighting the need for RAG-specific safety research.

resources.title: Anthropic achieves ISO 42001 certification for responsible AI
resources.description: News announcing Anthropic’s ISO/IEC 42001 certification, the first certifiable AI governance standard. The piece describes the company’s attainment of the standard for responsible AI governance and why ISO 42001 matters for operationalizing trust, transparency, and responsibility in GenAI and scaling structured ethics practices.

resources.title: Guide to Tracking LLM Token Usage with LangChain
resources.description: Hands-on LangChain documentation showing Python examples to track token usage and calculate per-request and cumulative costs for OpenAI Chat models. Demonstrates single-call and multi-call (chains/agents) scenarios and prints cost metrics. Useful for estimating API costs, comparing prompt changes' cost impact, and optimizing conversational workflows.

resources.title: Calculate token-based costs with LangSmith
resources.description: A how-to guide for calculating token-based costs of LLM usage using LangSmith (no-code). It shows measuring per-request and cumulative token charges for single calls and multi-step chains or agents, enabling developers to quantify billing impact of prompts and workflow changes to compare and optimize model costs.

resources.title: Reflexive Prompt Engineering for Responsible Interaction Design
resources.description: An arXiv paper presenting a five-part framework for responsible prompt engineering and interaction design. It outlines components such as prompt design, system configuration, and performance evaluation, and recommends embedding ethical guidelines into prompts to align model behavior with societal values in AI interactions.

resources.title: Generative AI for Beginners — 21-Lesson GitHub Course
resources.description: Open-source, 21-lesson GitHub course from Microsoft Cloud Advocates that teaches fundamentals of building generative AI applications. Combines "Learn" conceptual lessons and "Build" hands-on coding exercises in Python and TypeScript, covering LLMs, prompt engineering, and deployment, with additional resources for continued learning.

resources.title: OpenAI report: Expanding on sycophancy in models
resources.description: OpenAI article discussing sycophancy in their models and how it contributed to the rollback of their 4o model. It explains observed alignment issues and emphasizes the need for governance plans and regular audits to verify that deployed models continue performing as intended.

resources.title: Automating Security Detection Writing with LLMs
resources.description: Practical guide demonstrating how to use generative AI and LLMs to automate writing of security detection reports. It explains structuring prompts and integrating APIs to produce relevant, contextualized technical content, reducing repetitive report drafting and improving consistency, supporting scaling of detection engineering and speeding analyst workflows.

resources.title: Neural Networks and Deep Learning in 2025
resources.description: This Medium article reviews the evolution and 2025 state of neural networks and deep learning, surveying applications in autonomous vehicles, healthcare, and financial forecasting. It explains how these models are being integrated across industries and stresses the importance of addressing ethical implications to support human well-being.

resources.title: Audemy: Audio Learning Platform for Blind Students
resources.description: It is an AI-powered audio-based learning platform that delivers personalized educational content to blind and visually impaired students by adapting materials to individual learning needs and preferences. Iteratively developed with input from over 20 accessibility educators and currently serving 2,000+ BVI students, it aims to improve engagement and access to educational resources.

resources.title: Stanford HAI 2025 AI Index Report
resources.description: A 2025 report from Stanford University's Human-Centered AI (HAI) presenting data-driven analysis of AI trends, metrics, and societal impacts. It compiles indicators and findings to inform policymakers, researchers, and practitioners about adoption patterns, performance shifts, and risks in AI development. A separate page lists ten key takeaways.

resources.title: AWS Outposts Gen2 for Generative AI Workloads
resources.description: Announcement (AWS London Summit, Apr 30, 2025) of Outposts Generation 2, allowing selected AWS services to run locally in customer datacenters. Example shows EC2-hosted small language models and retrieval-augmented generation; SageMaker and Bedrock are not yet supported. Enables GenAI deployments with stricter data residency and privacy requirements.

resources.title: AI Ethics: Manual for Software Engineers
resources.description: Article outlining the ethical responsibilities software engineers face when building AI systems, presented with a humorous tone. It argues for integrating ethics into AI design and highlights practical challenges engineers must handle — including model bias, user privacy, and control/safety trade-offs — to prevent harm during development.

resources.title: From Automation to Orchestration: Leading AI Agents
resources.description: Medium article examining the shift from automation to orchestration, focusing on how to lead AI agents with purpose. It connects GenAI to the customer journey and discusses roles, coordination, and decision-making for deploying agent-based capabilities. Useful for practitioners integrating AI agents into customer-facing workflows and governance.

resources.title: Anthropic Console — Web Developer Dashboard
resources.description: A web-based developer dashboard for Anthropic's APIs and models. It provides access to account management, API keys, documentation, usage metrics and testing tools, enabling developers to configure and deploy Anthropic models. It matters because it makes Anthropic's services directly accessible and easier to integrate alongside other AI provider consoles.

resources.title: OpenAI Platform — API and Playground Dashboard
resources.description: OpenAI's developer platform and dashboard for accessing and managing OpenAI APIs, models, the web-based Playground, API keys, documentation, examples, fine-tuning tools, and usage/billing controls. It matters because it's the primary interface for developers and teams to test prompts, select models, deploy API calls, and monitor costs and usage.

resources.title: AWS Bedrock: managed foundation-model API service
resources.description: AWS Bedrock is a managed AWS service that provides API access to multiple foundation models from third-party and Amazon providers, plus tools for model customization, inference, and deployment. It matters because it centralizes model access, integrates with AWS identity, security, and scaling features, and simplifies operationalizing generative AI applications.

resources.title: Convert Speech to Text with Vertex AI
resources.description: Tutorial showing how to use Google Cloud's Vertex AI Studio to transcribe audio files into text. It covers uploading audio, choosing language, and obtaining transcriptions, enabling real-time speech-to-text workflows for applications like captions, call analysis, and conversational interfaces. Useful for developers implementing automated transcription on Vertex AI.

resources.title: Chain of Draft: Iterative Prompt Engineering Method
resources.description: Explains the "Chain of Draft" prompt-engineering technique: generate a rough draft from an LLM, then iteratively prompt focused revisions (tone, structure, accuracy, examples). It mirrors human editing to produce clearer, more accurate, and context-aware outputs, useful for drafting text, refining code, and planning workflows.

resources.title: Prompt Engineering for LLMs: Developer's Guide
