resources.description: This Medium article by Pankaj Pandey provides a practical developer-focused guide to advanced prompt engineering techniques—prompt chaining, few-shot learning, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). It includes clear examples and structuring advice to produce more reliable, context-aware LLM responses, useful for improving output consistency and collaborative prompt workflows.

resources.title: MIT Introduction to Deep Learning | 6.S191
resources.description: MIT Introduction to Deep Learning (6.S191) — Lecture 1: Foundations of Deep Learning (New 2025 Edition), presented by Alexander Amini. An accessible kickoff covering core concepts: neural network architectures, training and optimization, generalization, and practical lab workflows. Ideal for students and practitioners seeking a rigorous, hands-on introduction. Access the full lecture series, slides, and lab materials via the course page linked in the video description.

resources.title: Local AI Automation with n8n, Docker, and MCP
resources.description: Tutorial on building a fully local AI automation stack using n8n, Docker, and the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Covers setting up local LLMs, agentic workflows, RAG-style contexts, and integrations like Claude Desktop and the Brave Search API — useful for self-hosted, privacy-focused AI orchestration and no-code automation.

resources.title: Norma Kamali on AI and future fashion
resources.description: MIT News article profiling designer Norma Kamali and her exploration of artificial intelligence's role in shaping future fashion practices and design processes. It discusses practical and cultural implications of integrating AI into garment design and industry workflows, and notes Kamali recently completed the AGAI course with Dr. Abel.

resources.title: Making AI-generated code more accurate in any language
resources.description: An MIT News article reporting research that improves the accuracy of AI-generated code across programming languages. It outlines findings and approaches to reduce coding errors produced by AI models. This matters because more reliable code generation can decrease debugging, boost developer productivity, and broaden adoption of AI coding tools.

resources.title: Microsoft Used Generative AI in Surface Ad
resources.description: Report on a one-minute Surface Pro and Surface Laptop ad that used generative AI for visuals and script segments, airing on YouTube from Jan 30, 2025. AI elements were integrated with real footage and went unnoticed for nearly three months, cutting production time and costs by ~90% and affecting ad workflows.

resources.title: Hugging Face Spaces — Interactive Model Demos
resources.description: A collection of Hugging Face "Spaces" — hosted, user-created interactive demos for trying and experimenting with machine learning models. Useful for quickly testing model behavior, exploring capabilities, and sharing runnable examples that showcase how a model performs in practice, and comparing models.

resources.title: AI Spreading Stereotypes Across Languages and Cultures
resources.description: Article by Margaret Mitchell (Hugging Face) examining how open-source models propagate cultural biases, using the SHADES dataset from the BigScience project to measure stereotypes across languages via culturally informed translations. It matters because unchecked open-source models can introduce harmful stereotypes into languages and cultures that previously lacked them.

resources.title: Sam Altman TED Talk: ChatGPT, Agents, Superintelligence
resources.description: Recorded live at TED2025 (April 11, 2025), this interview features OpenAI CEO Sam Altman in conversation with TED head Chris Anderson about the rapid development of AI, ChatGPT and autonomous agents, and implications for safety, power and moral authority. It matters because it frames possible paths and risks as AI nears or exceeds human intelligence.

resources.title: How I'd Learn AI in 2025 (If I Knew Nothing)
resources.description: Medium article outlining a beginner-friendly, step-by-step plan for learning AI in 2025 focused on no-code tools and AI assistants. It explains practical pathways for non-technical people to explore AI concepts and build applications without prior coding, relevant because it lowers technical barriers and guides project or career decisions.

resources.title: Git Tutorial for Beginners — Intro to Git
resources.description: A beginner-focused Git tutorial covering basic Git concepts and common commands to build foundational version-control skills. Listed as one of three recommended Git introductions for the course, it helps learners prepare for collaborative development and upcoming lessons by teaching repository setup, commits, and branch basics.

resources.title: MIT Working Group on Generative AI and Work
resources.description: An MIT-led working group, supported by Google.org and collaborating with 25 organizations, is studying real-world generative AI applications to assess effects on job quality and equity. The initiative will develop training resources to help workers and employers adapt to AI-driven changes in tasks, skills, and workforce roles.

resources.title: Getting Started with LangChain: A Beginner-Friendly Guide
resources.description: This Medium tutorial provides runnable Python examples for installing LangChain, connecting a ChatOpenAI model, creating reusable PromptTemplates, composing chains, adding retrieval and memory, and launching an agent to build a PDF-aware chatbot in under 50 lines. It matters because it teaches modular LLM workflow components you can reuse and combine.

resources.title: Using OpenRouter to Access Free LLMs (2025)
resources.description: Explains how to access multiple LLMs for free via OpenRouter, with step-by-step instructions for signing up, creating an API key, and selecting available free models. Useful for professionals and developers who want to test and evaluate generative models on real tasks without incurring usage costs.

resources.title: Copilot Studio adds autonomous computer-use feature
resources.description: A new computer-use capability in Microsoft’s Copilot Studio lets AI agents interact directly with websites and desktop applications, clicking buttons, selecting menus, and entering data to simulate human interaction where APIs are unavailable. It matters because businesses can automate cross-application workflows and keep automations working despite interface changes.

resources.title: Going Digital at Scale: LLA's AWS Transformation Drives 25% of Revenue Through Online Channels
resources.description: Dragana Linfield, Senior Director at Liberty Latin America, joins AWS's Jesus Federico in the AWS Studio at MWC Barcelona to discuss LLA's large-scale AWS transformation. They describe how migrating to cloud-native architectures and leveraging AWS services enabled faster product launches, data‑driven personalization, and scalable online channels that now generate 25% of the company’s revenue — boosting customer experience and operational agility across markets.

resources.title: Building No-Code Agents with Zapier (Office Hours)
resources.description: A step-by-step Office Hours tutorial showing how to build no-code agents using Zapier from scratch with a free account. Demonstrates practical agent construction and workflow automation applicable to community platforms (e.g., Discord), useful for coordinators and members exploring automated, specialized agents without programming.

resources.title: TactileNet: AI-generated tactile graphics for accessibility
resources.description: An arXiv paper presenting TactileNet, an AI system that generates guideline-compliant tactile graphics for people with vision impairment. It converts visual content into touchable formats to improve access to educational materials and other visual information for users who rely on tactile perception.

resources.title: SQL Course for Beginners — Intro to SQL
resources.description: Beginner-focused SQL course introducing core SQL concepts and practical querying for working with relational databases. Covers fundamental skills needed for data retrieval, filtering, joining, and basic aggregation. Relevant for learners aiming to analyze datasets, build data-backed applications, and integrate databases into systems workflows.

resources.title: Jupyter Notebook Tutorial for Python Beginners
resources.description: Tutorial on using Jupyter (Python) notebooks for interactive coding and data analysis. Covers notebook interface, code and markdown cells, visualizations, and integration with libraries like pandas and NumPy. Useful for beginners to learn reproducible workflows, exploratory analysis, and sharing results — foundational for data science and rapid prototyping.

resources.title: NumPy Course: Numerical Python Fundamentals and Arrays
resources.description: Introductory NumPy course covering core concepts such as n-dimensional arrays, vectorized operations, broadcasting, and basic numerical routines. It teaches efficient array-based computing in Python, preparing learners for data analysis, scientific computing, and higher-level libraries like pandas and machine learning frameworks by providing fundamental performance-oriented data structures.

resources.title: Matplotlib Course Python Data Visualization Tutorial
resources.description: A tutorial course on using Matplotlib for Python data visualization. Covers creating charts, customizing plots, and integrating visuals with NumPy and pandas workflows. Useful for developers and analysts who need to present and inspect data, supporting the listed skills and aiding in building data-driven systems.

resources.title: Pandas Course: Data Analysis in Python
resources.description: A tutorial course introducing the pandas library for data manipulation and analysis in Python. It covers loading, cleaning, transforming, and summarizing tabular data, enabling exploratory analysis and dataset preparation for downstream tasks. Knowing pandas supports efficient data workflows when building data-driven systems and ML pipelines.

resources.title: OpenAI Codex CLI Getting Started Guide
resources.description: Official getting-started guide for OpenAI Codex CLI, an open-source command-line coding agent that runs in a secure, sandboxed environment. Explains manual interaction and full-automation mode for assembling and running code-driven workflows, enabling developers to prototype and automate app-building from the terminal while keeping execution isolated.

resources.title: OpenAI Codex CLI explained and demo
resources.description: Third-party explanatory video demonstrating OpenAI's open-source Codex CLI command-line coding agent, its sandboxed runtime, and manual versus automated modes for building complete applications. Useful for developers evaluating a scriptable toolchain for coding automation and secure testing environments. Includes link to the official Codex CLI getting-started guide.

resources.title: A Practical Guide to Building Agents
resources.description: A practical guide from OpenAI for product and engineering teams explaining what LLM-powered agents are, when to build them, and how to design, orchestrate, and deploy them safely. Covers use-case selection frameworks, agent architecture and control patterns, tool integration, testing, monitoring, and guardrails. Provides actionable best practices and checklists drawn from real deployments to create production-grade agents.

resources.title: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang's Vision for the Future
resources.description: Enhanced: NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang outlines the company’s next chapter: building a full-stack AI platform—from cutting-edge GPUs and custom chips to data-center infrastructure, software tools, and solutions for generative AI, autonomous machines, and edge computing. Hear how NVIDIA plans to scale AI across industries, reshape computing, and accelerate innovation. Subscribe to Huge If True for more optimistic science and tech stories and in-depth breakdowns of breakthroughs.

resources.title: Canva is now in the coding and spreadsheet business
resources.description: Canva’s Visual Suite 2.0 adds AI-powered tools — Canva Code and Canva Sheets — that generate websites, apps, and spreadsheets from text prompts without coding. It turns Canva into a single workspace for non-developers to prototype and collaborate on digital projects, affecting how businesses create and manage work.

resources.title: Apple’s Device-Based AI Training Using Synthetic Data
resources.description: Explains Apple’s method of training AI models by comparing synthetic data with anonymized samples from users who opt into Device Analytics. The approach keeps personal data on-device while allowing model improvement, aiming to enhance performance without transmitting raw user information and addressing privacy trade-offs.

resources.title: AI Scientist-v2: Automated Scientific Discovery System
resources.description: An autonomous system that formulates hypotheses, runs experiments, analyzes data, and writes manuscripts using agentic tree search. Its developers report a fully AI-generated paper accepted at an ICLR workshop, demonstrating the system can perform end-to-end scientific workflows and produce workshop-level research contributions.

resources.title: Interview: Clayton Christensen on The Innovator's Dilemma
resources.description: An interview with Clayton Christensen discussing The Innovator's Dilemma, with an Andy Grove anecdote around 4:00. The conversation explores how organizations respond to disruptive innovation and why teaching people how to think—rather than what to think—matters for decision-making, critical thinking, and evaluating AI outputs.

resources.title: WEF Future of Jobs Report 2025 — Workforce Outlook
resources.description: Workforce outlook and labour‑market projections from the World Economic Forum’s Future of Jobs Report 2025, detailing projected job gains/losses, skills gaps, and sectoral shifts. It covers impacts of AI, automation, data and analytics, cloud and digital platforms, and green transition technologies, plus reskilling strategies and policy responses. Drawn from employer surveys and labour‑market analysis, the report targets policymakers, business and HR leaders, educators, and researchers.

resources.title: Company Surprises Workers with Deepfake Hugs
resources.description: A Good News Network video showing a company surprising employees by presenting personalized, deepfake-generated hugs from people they most wished to see for the holidays. It documents a positive application of synthetic media to provide emotional comfort and connection, illustrating how deepfakes can be used ethically to reduce isolation and boost morale.

resources.title: Ed on a story's impact on his life
resources.description: A video in which Ed talks about how a particular story affected his life and emotions. Shared in the channel as a personal testimony that moved the sharer nearly to tears. The post also acknowledges ElevenLabs (likely involved in the audio/voice) and provides a direct link to the clip.

resources.title: Future You: AI-simulated Future-Self Chat Tool
resources.description: An AI tool that generates a virtual version of a user's future self for short conversational interactions. In user studies, participants reported reduced anxiety and a stronger sense of connection to long-term goals, indicating the approach could be used to study and potentially support mental well-being and future-oriented motivation.

resources.title: Shopify mandates AI use across all teams
resources.description: Report on Shopify CEO Toby Askiluk requiring AI use for all employees and projects. Prototypes are now AI-driven experiments; staff must learn and share AI skills. Teams must demonstrate how AI could handle tasks before requesting hires. Framed as rethinking work rather than layoffs, this approach influenced IBM and Microsoft.

resources.title: Tutorial shared by teammate on WhatsApp
resources.description: This is a tutorial video link shared by a teammate on WhatsApp and posted in the IT-support channel. Use it as a reference for the team's support tasks, troubleshooting steps, or training. Check the video for procedural demonstrations and seek clarifications from the original sharer before applying changes.

resources.title: Self-paced course on building agents
resources.description: A self-paced Hugging Face course on building agents. It presents foundational concepts and practical guidance for designing, implementing, and testing agents, aimed at developers and researchers. Useful for learning applied skills to create, evaluate, and integrate agent-based components into software projects.

resources.title: Introductory Discord guide for Spanish speakers
resources.description: Spanish-language introductory guide to Discord basics and setup, intended for Spanish speakers. Covers fundamental features (servers, channels, voice/text communication) and basic community participation. Useful because it helps Spanish-speaking beginners learn to navigate and use Discord effectively for joining or running communities.
